headline: Exxon and 15 More ‘Quality’ Stocks to Own for a Volatile Market
summary: The market has staged an impressive rebound, but is in for more volatility.  The overarching up-and-down dynamic starts with the fact that sellers have been coming in near the market’s highs to knock stock prices lower because investors and traders know that the more artificial-intelligence spending happens today, the greater the likelihood that the spending will collapse tomorrow.  The  Cboe  Volatility Index, which shows the magnitude of expected swings in stock prices, hit 18 early Monday, down from about 26 in mid November but above its low for the year of about 14.

headline: Duke Energy (DUK): Examining Valuation After a Year of Consistent Returns
summary: Duke Energy (DUK) shares have drawn attention recently, as investors review its recent performance and consider how steady income from utilities might fit into portfolios. With the stock showing consistent returns over the past year, there is renewed interest in its outlook. See our latest analysis for Duke Energy. Duke Energy’s share price has shown solid momentum so far this year, with a year-to-date gain of nearly 15%. This has reinforced confidence among investors who prize reliable...

headline: DUK Stock Underperforms Industry in 6 Months: Here's How to Play
summary: Duke Energy's clean-energy push, nuclear expansion and major capital plans highlight growth potential despite its premium valuation.
